entry.title: [Fast Pair] Check devices are connected on DevicePairedChanged events
entry.content:
Fast Pair is creating MessageStream connections to disconnected

devices as a result of DevicePairedChanged geting called when the

adapter first becomes available. When the first connection request

to a device is called for the MessageStream UUID, it prevents other

profiles from automatically connecting.



To prevent Fast Pair from creating the first connection attempt,

a check has been added to make sure DevicePairedChanged events only

attempt MessageStream connections for connected Bluetooth devices.



Bug: b/303119640

entry.title: Reland "Expose effects processor from MediaEffectsService up to content client"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit fd87acad3272d2447b46a6bd5972378106cb62b1



Original CL was failing in CI because of a missing dependency from

content/browser:browser to services/video_effects/public/mojom:mojom

target (now required because of a transitive include). This was

missing because content/brower:browser does not depend on the target

where the public_deps entry was added. The reland addresses it by

explicitly adding the dependency, compare PS1 and PS2 to see the

change.



Original change's description:

> Expose effects processor from MediaEffectsService up to content client

>

> Additionally, add unit tests for VideoEffectsProcessor that mostly

> mimic the tests that have been written for Video Effects Manager. This

> also includes a basic fake implementation of VideoEffectsService and

> VideoEffectsProcessor.

>

> MediaEffectsService header file also now exposes a way to override the

> VideoEffectsService for testing, as otherwise it'd have to spawn a new

> utility process, and this is not desired in unittests.

>

> Bug: b:328118837

> Change-Id: Id096ecb09e0059d660896d743b80c991915dc4ff

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5353891

> Reviewed-by: Bryant Chandler

> Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

> Commit-Queue: Piotr Bialecki

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278592}

entry.title: Remove content_settings::RefCountedAutoLock indirection
entry.content:
The pointer to the lock is either passed using std::move(), or is the

last instruction in the function, so there is effectively only one real

owner. Using std::unique_ptr on base::AutoLock directly will suffice.

compatible version numbers).

config table.

entry.title: Get watermark feature ready for trusted testing.
entry.content:
Fix switching between tab when loading is slow.

Fix watermark appearing over ntp.

Fix lookups being made to chrome:// URLs during tab switches.



This CL includes a code to use the OnLoad signal to make sure that a

page that a page that should be watrmarked always is at the expense of

momentarily showing a watermark over a page that does not need one.

A better signal would be FCP, see b/330960313 for more details.

entry.title: Add SetCompletionSyncToken to WebGPUMailboxTexture.
entry.content:
When Canvas WebGPU access is ended, it needs to synchronize the

step of copying the GPU texture into the 2D canvas in order to

avoid racing and destroying objects too quickly. To make this

work, WebGPUMailboxTextures that wrap a recyclable canvas

resource now allow the completion sync token to be explicitly

set. Previously, the completion sync token was created inside

WebGPURecyclableResourceCache::OnDestroyRecyclableResource as

an implicit part of the teardown process.



Bug: 41490345

entry.title: PrivateAggregation: Add histogram for time until report request
entry.content:
This CL adds a new histogram:

PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.Host.TimeToGenerateReportRequestWithContextId



When the PrivateAggregationHost's timer fires or its Mojo pipe is

disconnected, it starts doing some work before ultimately generating a

report request. This new histogram captures the duration of time between

these two events.



The new histogram is recorded only for report requests that have a

context ID. The reason for this histogram is that we're concerned about

potentially revealing information to servers via the report timestamp.

Thus, we really only care about reports with context IDs, since we

employ the "reduced delay" strategy [0] for these reports.



[0]: https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/private-aggregation-api/blob/main/report_verification.md#reduced-delay



Change-Id: I9152d0b097fc8fe41dbb2c999715f69d74faf5c4

entry.title: snap-group: Snap ratio diff consideration in STR
entry.content:
When replacing a window within an existing snap group, we'll first

calculate the snap ratio difference between the new window and the

one it's replacing. If the difference is below the threshold, the

replacement will occur, preserving the previous snap ratios within

the group been replaced. Otherwise, a new faster split-screen

session will be initiated.



Demo: http://b/330418650#comment2

entry.title: [css-anchor-position] Basic support for position-visibility: no-overflow
entry.content:
https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7758#issuecomment-1965540529

no-overflow hides the abspos if it overflows its inset-modified

containing block (after exhausting all position-try options, if

relevant). Note this value would apply even when using regular

abspos or fixedpos.



PaintLayer::SetInvisibleForPositionVisibility to track if the layer

needs to be invisible for any position-visibility constraint. The

function is called when the abspos needs to be invisible due to

no-overflow. The layer, as well certain descendant layers [1] in

containing block hierarchy will be skipped during hit-testing and

paint.



[1] We should skip all descendant layers in containing block

hierarchy, but this CL fails to skip self-painting descendant layers

if the layer is not a stacking context. The issue will be addressed

in a followup.



Bug: 329703412

entry.title: oak birch: show/hide bar by context menu
entry.content:
This cl implements showing/hiding the birch bars from context menu.



When the user selects showing suggestions, the birch bar controller will

re-fetch the data from birch model and ask all overview grids to create

birch bars.



When the user deselects showing suggestions, the birch bar controller

will ask all overview grids to destroy the birch bars.



We set a user pref to memorize the user's selection of showing/hiding

birch bar.



Demo is shown in the bug comment. A unit test will be added in a

following cl.



Bug: b:329665146

Change-Id: I3f8e426bf8a6bc9893280c0e82d624894b82435c

entry.title: webauthn: splitting the model, step 2.
entry.content:
This change creates the new model class, but makes the controller class

still forward everything to it, thus limiting the size of the change.



Some other changes were needed:



1. AuthenticatorRequestDialogController(nullptr) becomes ambiguous with

the compatibility constructor and so casts are needed where this

pattern is used.

2. `OnGPMPinOptionChanged` is likewise.

3. `OnBluetoothPoweredStateChanged` was both on the Observer and, as a

separate function on the model (now controller). Since the controller

now observes the model, these collide and the second is renamed

`BluetoothAdapterPowerChanged`.

4. `Cancel` is too generic and collides between the sheet model and

dialog model. Thus the dialog model now calls it

`CancelAuthenticatorRequest`.



Bug: 330750582

entry.title: Store interop parameters in auxiliary data structures
entry.content:
Instead of assuming that various operations happen in order.



Since each interop event has a unique time, this makes it easier to

ensure that the correct response is associated with each event. Without

this, there is the possibility of a race condition between the

asynchronous registration handling from the data host manager and the

storage-sequence task.



This will make it easier to support redirect chains in interop tests

without flakiness.

entry.title: Avoid several unnecessary URL host string copies
entry.content:
We make a lot of copies of the host string to construct

SecurityOrigins to perform same origin checks. It'd be nice

to have a fast path to do this, but here we just avoid some

unnecessary construction on hot code paths.



For the IDNA deviation character warning, we order the check for

this rare case first, so we can short circuit the origin check in

most cases.



In AddClientHintsIfNecessary, the same SecurityOrigin gets

constructed twice. We deduplicate this.



We also make more use of string views for hot path KURL::Host

callers that are trivial to convert.



Based on local testing, loading the youtube home page, without

this CL we have 3737 calls to KURL::Host taking a total of

22.0ms. With this CL we have 2241 calls taking 14.5ms.



Bug: None

Chrome (explicitly) or/and on the Web. The default value displayed

should be based on the first interaction with the Chrome Signin Bubble.

yet, the default is no option selected.

account signed in.

the final version in a followup CL (removing the translatable=false).

entry.title: Clean up temporary directory even if its sub-dir is not empty.
entry.content:
When Lacros fails to launch ash within the timeout limits, it

will kill the ash instance and clean up the temporary directories,

then re-try launching test_ash_chrome again. However, ash may

not be killed immediately and can continue to run a while

before it eventually gets killed. It may have already created

some profile data under the "Default" directory of user-date-dir,

which makes test_runner fail without re-trying launching ash.



This cl will allow _CleanDir to clean up the sub-directories

even if they are not empty by igoring the errors, so that

test_runner will continue to retry ash launching as expected.



Bug: 329714115

Change-Id: I092ea338bc385a052d7582166b348afdfb974c55

entry.title: [BRP] Unrewrite raw_ptr/raw_ref under Paint code
entry.content:
renderer/platform/graphics/paint, renderer/platform/graphics/compositing and renderer/core/paint are being Oilpanized, which should take precedence over MiraclePtr.



Moreover, we've recently observed some Renderer regressions related to MiraclePtr. While no relation with these pointers have been observed, better to unrewrite things that are unnecessary.



No need for RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION, as the paths are added to kRawPtrManualPathsToIgnore. Ok to keep existing annotations, as they carry information about performance, in case MiraclePtr'ization effort is evered resumed.



Bug: 330759291

entry.title: autosleep: Prevent timer restart when the timezone does not change
entry.content:
The timezone changed callback is called every time the device wakes

from suspend even if the timezone does not change. This can cause

the timer to be incorrectly restarted when the user manually wakes

the device up from sleep. This CL adds a check to prevent running

the timezone change logic when the actual timezone does not change.



Bug: b:319083880

entry.title: [autofill] Fix 3 line suggestion margin
entry.content:
The new autofill design is deducting the horizontal margin in

GetMarginsForContentCell, from 12px to 8px. However, later there is a

specific check for when suggestions have 2 lines labels, where the

vertical margin is increased (which is ok), however it also resets the

horizontal ones back to the default value store in the base popup class



This fix simply makes sure that we only update the vertical margins,

which is what we care about, therefore this is a proper fix.



Nonetheless there is a follow up step to be taken: Make this code simpler to understand and follow. Margins should be

defined in only one place.



Demo:https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDYyMzg3Mjg1Nzk5NzMxMnwxMjIyMzM3Yy1mMQ

entry.title: ash: BootTimeRecorder should not observe OobeUI
entry.content:
BootTimeRecorder should record timings for the restored tabs.

This CL removes BootTimesRecorderTabHelper for OobeUI so that

BootTimeRecorder is not created for OobeUI and does not record

timings for it.



This CL also drops "LoginDone" from "TabPaint" to make login timings

are recorded more consistently. It was added in the thinking that

either the first tab paint or finish of browser session restore

concludes the user login. However, this could hide problems

of slower browser session restores and makes it more difficult to

understand "BootTime.Login2".

entry.title: Reland "Reland "Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants""
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d1cd395e3557aa8690b2f5620c2c1742cedc4ce8



More similar flakes occured for a different (precedence) test case.

this CL updates the conditions to wait for the

content::CookieChangeObserver making sure

test_case_.allow_by_explicit_setting precedence test case is fully

considered.



Original change's description:

> Reland "Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants"

>

> This is a reland of commit 9808ffb946ced743655507f56986b0fe9cea5019

>

> The test is flaky at the level histogram bucket count, reporting 1 count instead of 2 base on cookie write/reads with ExecJs. This reland disables the flaky platforms with a tracking bug to resolve the flakiness.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants

> >

> > This CL set precedence to allow first priority consideration of our long term solutions, to enhance visibility on their web ecosystem adoption.

> > Similarly, sites controlled mechanisms should be check before Chrome

> > ones, and user controlled mechanisms should come last as in an ideal

> > scenario users shouldn't need to trigger them.

> >

> > The predefined and defaulted controls will always come first.

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism2 is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism3

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus2

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests2 is replaced by API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests3

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment is replaced by Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment2

> >

> >

> > Change-Id: Iebe37f089a1f25fc07d78446851ca5a6d2175165

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331513

entry.title: [accessibility] Add the UiAutomationProviderEnabled enterprise policy
entry.content:
This policy can be used by enterprise administrators to enable or

disable the browser's UI Automation accessibility framework provider for

use by accessibility tools.

entry.title: Update OAuthHostStarter to use DirectoryServiceClient
entry.content:
OAuthHostStarterImpl (renamed to OAuthHostStarter in this CL) relied

on ServiceClient to make the register and delete service calls to

our backend. I had planned on updating ServiceClient to use callbacks

rather than a delegate interface but when I looked at the

ServiceClient impl, it didn't really do anything useful. It may have

been helpful when we had HostStarter and HostStopper classes but

that is consolidated now and the class also obscured the response

codes we get back from the service.



Thus in this CL I move HttpProtobufStatus error handling into the

base class, removed ServiceClient, and updated OAuthHostStarter to

use the DirectoryServiceClient directly which cleaned up its

implementation a bit as well.



I also renamed OAuthHostStarterImpl to OAuthHostStarter because the

'Impl ' suffix was redundant.



Bug: b/320745119, b/330404222

Change-Id: I3bff874413226482cbb95afd97f822d03d3b49e9

entry.title: hunspell: Remove LineIterator::AdvanceAndCopy in our bdict patch
entry.content:
This cleanup is in preparation for reworking bdict_reader.cc to use

spans for bounds-checking and also avoid a UBSan error caused by invalid

pointer casts. But I wanted to get this method out of the way first.



Previously, we would copy into a 65K buffer embedded in FileMgr. This

buffer seems to have been copied from the original upstream FileMgr.

Interestingly, upstream doesn't seem to actually use it either. It was

removed in

https://github.com/hunspell/hunspell/commit/42b8e241afcd1576a5e670aebd20f965260c32d7

and never cleaned up.



Regardless, we don't need it because we already keep the entire bdict in

memory and return a NUL-terminated C string. We can simply return that

directly. This also fixes a bug / weird behavior: AdvanceAndCopy would

truncate the line to the output buffer. In doing so, it didn't find the

end of the string, so we'd actually split the element in two and return

a *different* sequence of lines than if we called Advance.



Change-Id: I980fe2f9b197fe24c717d65e9d693dd6a7539053

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5388542

entry.title: [Clipboard] Mark passwords as sensitive in Android.
entry.content:
When privacy type is set as `kNoDisplay`, mark the data copied to

plain text format as EXTRA_IS_SENSITIVE and set the password data.



Callers that set this privacy type, copy the password in plain text

format which is not treated as concealed data, so setting the

password data via `setPassword` treats the data as confidential.



Continuation of crrev.com/c/5347639 to extend privacy features on

platforms that support adding confidential data such as passwords.



Bug: 40945200

entry.title: [Reland 1] lens overlay: Fix context menu entry point.
entry.content:
The original CL modifies a kombucha test. The modified test fails in

ubsan builds. This appears to be a race condition in kombucha itself, as

kombucha steps run nested by default. This reland takes all the kombucha

steps and flushes events after every step to avoid this

non-deterministic and racy behavior.



> This CL allows us to correctly hook up the CUJ test. This CL prevents

> lens overlay from triggering for non-normal windows.

entry.title: Add VisitedLinkNavigationThrottle to retrieve origin salt
entry.content:
This CL creates a navigation throttle to identify the visited link salt

value corresponding to the navigation's origin to be committed. This

salt is then added to the navigation's commit_params. In later CLs, we

will retrieve this value from the commit_params and access it (via

Document) in VisitedLinkState in the renderer.



These salt values are generated and stored in VisitedLinkWriter. Each

unique origin has a unique uint64_t salt value used when hashing the

partitioned :visited link hashtable.



In this CL, salts are generated but not currently used in creating the

hashtable. But will be used to partition the hashtable in future CLs.



Design Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19qYPkfPNkPnmVcZ6jjl7jR8JPKY6j4rTjfoFRHll2IQ/edit?usp=sharing



Fixed: 329046735

entry.title: [ SavedTabGroups ] Update KeyedService to return ids when appropriate
entry.content:
This functionality is useful when you need to immediately use the id that was created and used within `OpenSavedTabGroupInBrowser()` or `SaveGroup`.



Changes:

- `OpenSavedTabGroupInBrowser` now returns an optional TabGroupId

- `SaveGroup` now returns a Uuid.



Example situations to use:

- After calling `OpenSavedTabGroupInBrowser`, you may want to update the visual data, or look at the position of tabs in the Tabstrip.

- After calling SaveGroup, you may want to retrieve the group from the SavedTabGroupModel.

entry.title: [ASH] Fix a bug in returning the package name via identity sharing
entry.content:
LauncherIntentDispatcher#getCallingPackageIdentitySharing had a bug that

could return a wrong non-null package name as opposed to returning

the correct calling app's package name due to the way Chrome handles

the incoming intent using a trampoline activity. This CL fixes it:



- Just like how the dispatcher populates the intent data provider with

the right package name from service connection/startActivityForResult,

we define a new param in the provider for the package name obtained

from identity sharing API.

- Revert the API above to private, non-static, since it returns the

package name of the trampline activity instead of that of the calling

app if passed CustomTabActivity.



Bug: 330118241

entry.title: [Ozone/Wayland]Only create augmented_surface for delegated surfaces
entry.content:
If the surface is a subsurface of root_window/widget, the surface

should be a compositing target object. This allows separation of

wl_subsurface for ui bubble widgets vs delegated compositing, and

prevents unnecessary operations when building the ui window tree

structure in ash.
